events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The insurance team categorized the claim as an auto accident claim following the initial review of the customer's incident report and description.
An agent was assigned to the claim to handle further communication and to coordinate the investigation process with the customer.
The customer received an acknowledgment notification confirming that the claim has been received and is now under review by the insurance company.
The agent requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and any witness statements related to the collision.
The customer submitted all the requested documents including detailed pictures of the car damage, a copy of the police report, and witness contact details.
An investigation was initiated by the claims department to verify the circumstances of the accident and liability based on the submitted evidence.
The investigation was completed confirming the details of the collision matched the customer's report and liability was assigned accordingly.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on the damage assessment and policy coverage to cover vehicle repairs and related costs.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the compensation amount offered.
The claim was officially approved as per company policy, authorizing payment for damages and related expenses as agreed in the settlement.
The payment for the approved claim was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s designated account for vehicle repair costs.
Following the successful settlement and payment, the claim has been formally closed with no further action required.
The claim file was archived in the company's records system for future reference and compliance with regulatory retention requirements.
